title: How to Fix Very Dry Raisins or Sultanas

steps.headline: Place the raisins or sultanas into a colander.
steps.description: Place under a running tap to wash them. Shake the colander around a little to ensure that all of the raisins or sultanas are washed.

steps.headline: Place baking paper over a baking tray or sheet.
steps.description: Arrange the washed raisins or sultanas across the baking tray or sheet. Try to avoid having any sitting on top of each other.

steps.headline: Place the raisins or sultanas on the tray into the oven.
steps.description: Cook until they they puff out. This won't take very long (just a few minutes), so keep an eye on them (they harden if left too long).

steps.headline: Remove from the oven and allow to cool.
steps.description: They should be soft again and ready to eat or use for cooking.

text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Place the raisins or sultanas into a colander. Place under a running tap to wash them. Shake the colander around a little to ensure that all of the raisins or sultanas are washed. Place baking paper over a baking tray or sheet. Arrange the washed raisins or sultanas across the baking tray or sheet. Try to avoid having any sitting on top of each other. Place the raisins or sultanas on the tray into the oven. Cook until they they puff out. This won't take very long (just a few minutes), so keep an eye on them (they harden if left too long). Remove from the oven and allow to cool. They should be soft again and ready to eat or use for cooking.
